alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 7:20AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Pike, southern Autauga and Lowndes Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 720 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mulberry to 9 miles west of Pine Apple. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Prattville, Fort Deposit, Mosses, Hayneville, Goshen, Autaugaville, White Hall, Gordonville, Lowndesboro, Benton, Beechwood, Autauga County Airport, Davenport, Mulberry, Lowndes County Airport, Kent, Logan, Ansley, Lapine and Calhoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
